fullDescription.intro:
Extracts relations triplets contained in sentences of a document. The node needs part-of-speech tagged documents. Using a tagger for named-entity recognition might enhance the results. Additionally, there has to be a second document column containing lemmatized documents, which consist of terms converted to their canonical, dictionary or citation form.
However, this node can also be used with plain documents by using the Apply preprocessing option. If this option is selected, part-of-speech tagging, named-entity tagging and lemmatizing are done by this node. The Stanford CoreNLP default settings are used in this case.
The node creates four new columns: a subject column, an object column, a predicate column and a column containing the confidence for the relation between the subject and the object.
Note: Open Information Extraction is a computationally expensive operation. For the usage of this node it is recommended to run KNIME with at least 2GB of heap space. To increase the heap space, change the -Xmx setting in the knime.ini file.
This node is based on Stanford CoreNLP 3.9.1.
For more information about StanfordNLP and Open Information Extraction, click here.
fullDescription.option:
The document column to use.
Note: If the Apply preprocessing option is unchecked, the documents have to be tagged by a part-of-speech tagger. Named-entity tagging is recommended as well, but optional.
The document column containing the lemmatized documents.

If checked, part-of-speech tagging, named-entity tagging and lemmatizing will be done by this node. These tasks are applied internally and do not affect the documents in the document column. Extracting tags and lemmas produced by checking this option is not possible.
The number of threads to use.
If checked, results will be returned as lemma.
If checked, co-reference solution will be applied. Pronomial mentions will be replaced with their canonical mention in the text.
The affinity value above which confidence of the extraction is taken as 1.0.

If checked, extract triples only if they consume the entire fragment. This is useful for ensuring that only logically warranted triples are extracted, but puts more burden on the entailment system to find minimal phrases (see -max_entailments_per_clause).
If checked, extract nominal relations always and not only when a named entity tag warrants it. This greatly overproduces such triples, but can be useful in certain situations.

ports.inPort: The input table which contains the documents and lemmatized documents (if needed).
ports.outPort: The output table which contains data from the input table, extracted relations and a relation confidence.
